Question: You are coming up to a school patrol crossing and both signs are held out. When can you drive on?

Answers.Answer: When both signs have been pulled in
When there are no pedestrians on the crossing
When the sign on your side of the crossing has been pulled in
When there are no pedestrians on your half of the crossing

Question: What may you do at traffic signals if there is a green arrow pointing to the right and a red light showing at the same time?

Answers.Answer: You may turn right
You may go straight ahead
You must stop until all lights turn green
You may turn left or right

Question: You are driving past a line of parked cars. You notice a ball bouncing out into the road ahead. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Keep driving at the same speed
Keep driving at the same speed and flash the vehicle’s headlights
Slow down and be prepared to stop for children
Slow down and move to the right-hand side of the road

Question: Before any modification is carried out on your vehicle, you should:

Answers.Answer: remove the registration plates from your vehicle
check with an authorised vehicle inspection centre
check that your warrant of fitness is current to within 1 month
record the modification on your vehicle ownership papers

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?

Answers.Answer: Yes
No

Answers.Answer: True
False

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?

Answers.Answer: Yes
No

Question: What is shown by a white reflector (cat’s eye) placed on the road?

Answers.Answer: The left side of the road
The centre of the road
No passing
The far right side of the road

Question: What do these road markings mean?

Answers.Answer: Turning vehicles should enter turning lane at arrows and avoid striped area
Turning vehicles should avoid all road markings and use the left-hand lane
All vehicles can make a U-turn at these road markings
Turning vehicles drive straight over all road markings and wait to turn right

Question: What should you do if your vehicle breaks down on a motorway?

Answers.Answer: Walk to get help
Wave down a passing vehicle
Lift up the bonnet and boot of your vehicle
Push your vehicle to the nearest off-ramp

Question: When coming to a pedestrian crossing with a raised traffic island in the middle, what must you do?

Answers.Answer: Give way to pedestrians who are on your half of the road
Give way to pedestrians on the other side of the road
Remain stopped until the pedestrian has reached the other side of the road
Drive on as pedestrians will give way to all on coming traffic

Question: If you have had a flat tyre and have fitted a ‘space saver wheel’ what must you do?

Answers.Answer: Drive normally
Drive directly to a place where the flat tyre can be repaired and replaced
Drive at 40km/h until the flat tyre has been repaired
Lower the pressure in the other tyres

Question: How close may you park your vehicle to an intersection where no broken yellow lines have been marked?

Answers.Answer: 3 metres
4 metres
5 metres
6 metres

Question: If you are a driver involved in a crash, what is the FIRST action you should take?

Answers.Answer: Stop and place a warning triangle at the side of the road
Drive past at 20km/h until you pass the site of the crash
Stop and check to see if anyone is hurt
Tell a police officer as soon as possible

Question: When following a vehicle on a dusty metal (gravel) road, you should:

Answers.Answer: keep close to the other vehicles
drive down the centre of the road
adjust your speed to suit the conditions
pass the vehicle in front of you

Question: What is the recommended distance you should allow when driving past a cyclist?

Answers.Answer: 0.5 metres
1.0 metres
1.5 metres
2.0 metres

Question: The 100km/h speed limit sign shown is the minimum speed you are allowed to drive in good conditions.

Answers.Answer: True
False

Question: What should you do if the vehicle behind you starts to pass you?

Answers.Answer: Move over to the right so that they cannot pass
Speed up so that they will not need to pass
Signal for them to stay behind you because you think they are going too fast
Move as far to the left side of the road as is safe and do not speed up

Question: What does the legal definition of a road include?

Answers.Answer: Streets and motorways
Bridges and car parks
Beaches
All of the above

Question: Who may legally require you to give a blood sample?

Answers.Answer: A police officer, an ambulance officer, other crash party
A medical doctor, other crash party, a police officer
A police officer, a medical doctor or an approved person
An ambulance driver, an approved person or a medical doctor

Answers.Answer: Yes
No

Question: When should you use your hazard lights?

Answers.Answer: When your vehicle becomes a temporary hazard to other road users
Before changing lanes
When approaching an accident scene to warn other drivers
When reversing from a driveway and your view is not clear

Question: If your car was first registered before 1 January 2000, you must renew its warrant of fitness every:

Answers.Answer: 3 months
6 months
9 months
12 months

Do not drive faster than 100km/h unless the road is clear
Do not drive faster than 100km/h
A rest area is 100 metres ahead

Answers.Answer: A
B
C

Question: What must you do when red lights are flashing at a railway level crossing?

Answers.Answer: Drive over the lines as soon as the train has passed
Slow down and then drive over the lines
Stop until the lights stop flashing
Stop and if no train is coming you may drive over the lines
